channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: RL$^3$: Boosting Meta Reinforcement Learning via RL inside RL$^2$
item.description: Meta reinforcement learning (meta-RL) methods such as RL$^2$ have emerged as promising approaches for learning data-efficient RL algorithms tailored to a given task distribution.

item.title: Dynamic Path-Controllable Deep Unfolding Network for Compressive Sensing
item.description: Deep unfolding network (DUN) that unfolds the optimization algorithm into a deep neural network has achieved great success in compressive sensing (CS) due to its good interpretability and high performance.

item.title: Reduce Computational Complexity for Convolutional Layers by Skipping Zeros
item.description: This paper gives C-K-S algorithm (ConvV2, KS-deconv, Sk-dilated), which skips these 0s in two ways: trim the filters to exclude padded 0s; transform sparse tensors to dense tensors, to avoid inserted 0s in deconvolution and dilated-convolution.

item.title: MultiZoo & MultiBench: A Standardized Toolkit for Multimodal Deep Learning
item.description: Learning multimodal representations involves integrating information from multiple heterogeneous sources of data.

item.title: Land Cover Segmentation with Sparse Annotations from Sentinel-2 Imagery
item.description: Land cover (LC) segmentation plays a critical role in various applications, including environmental analysis and natural disaster management.

item.title: Large Language Model as Attributed Training Data Generator: A Tale of Diversity and Bias
item.description: Additionally, we present a comprehensive empirical study on data generation encompassing vital aspects like bias, diversity, and efficiency, and highlight three key observations: firstly, synthetic datasets generated by simple prompts exhibit significant biases, such as regional bias; secondly, attribute diversity plays a pivotal role in enhancing model performance; lastly, attributed prompts achieve the performance of simple class-conditional prompts while utilizing only 5\% of the querying cost of ChatGPT associated with the latter.

item.title: Taqyim: Evaluating Arabic NLP Tasks Using ChatGPT Models
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) have demonstrated impressive performance on various downstream tasks without requiring fine-tuning, including ChatGPT, a chat-based model built on top of LLMs such as GPT-3. 5 and GPT-4.

item.title: Points for Energy Renovation (PointER): A LiDAR-Derived Point Cloud Dataset of One Million English Buildings Linked to Energy Characteristics
item.description: Building point clouds in new regions can be generated with the open-source code published alongside the paper.

item.title: Time Regularization in Optimal Time Variable Learning
item.description: Recently, optimal time variable learning in deep neural networks (DNNs) was introduced in arXiv:2204. 08528.

item.title: CBBQ: A Chinese Bias Benchmark Dataset Curated with Human-AI Collaboration for Large Language Models
item.description: In this work, we present a Chinese Bias Benchmark dataset that consists of over 100K questions jointly constructed by human experts and generative language models, covering stereotypes and societal biases in 14 social dimensions related to Chinese culture and values.

item.title: Towards Open Vocabulary Learning: A Survey
item.description: To our knowledge, this is the first comprehensive literature review of open vocabulary learning.

item.title: Accelerating Sampling and Aggregation Operations in GNN Frameworks with GPU Initiated Direct Storage Accesses
item.description: To address these issues, we propose the GPU Initiated Direct Storage Access (GIDS) dataloader, to enable GPU-oriented GNN training for large-scale graphs while efficiently utilizing all hardware resources, such as CPU memory, storage, and GPU memory with a hybrid data placement strategy.

item.title: A Framework for Identifying Depression on Social Media: MentalRiskES@IberLEF 2023
item.description: This paper describes our participation in the MentalRiskES task at IberLEF 2023.

item.title: Neural directional distance field object representation for uni-directional path-traced rendering
item.description: Faster rendering of synthetic images is a core problem in the field of computer graphics.

item.title: Systematic analysis of the impact of label noise correction on ML Fairness
item.description: We apply the methodology to analyze six label noise correction methods according to several fairness metrics on standard OpenML datasets.

item.title: Distributional Modeling for Location-Aware Adversarial Patches
item.description: In this paper, we propose the Distribution-Optimized Adversarial Patch (DOPatch), a novel method that optimizes a multimodal distribution of adversarial locations instead of individual ones.

item.title: Individual and Structural Graph Information Bottlenecks for Out-of-Distribution Generalization
item.description: To remove class spurious feature caused by distribution shifts, we propose Individual Graph Information Bottleneck (I-GIB) which discards irrelevant information by minimizing the mutual information between the input graph and its embeddings.

item.title: Generalizing Surgical Instruments Segmentation to Unseen Domains with One-to-Many Synthesis
item.description: In this work, we mitigate data-related issues by efficiently leveraging minimal source images to generate synthetic surgical instrument segmentation datasets and achieve outstanding generalization performance on unseen real domains.

item.title: Separable Physics-Informed Neural Networks
item.description: The number of training points (collocation points) required on these challenging PDEs grows substantially, but it is severely limited due to the expensive computational costs and heavy memory overhead.

item.title: Curious Replay for Model-based Adaptation
item.description: Agents must be able to adapt quickly as an environment changes.

item.title: S2SNet: A Pretrained Neural Network for Superconductivity Discovery
item.description: To the best of our knowledge, S2SNet is the first work to predict superconductivity with only information of crystal structures.

item.title: Most Language Models can be Poets too: An AI Writing Assistant and Constrained Text Generation Studio
item.description: We present a simple and universally applicable technique for modifying the output of a language model by compositionally applying filter functions to the language models vocabulary before a unit of text is generated.

item.title: More efficient manual review of automatically transcribed tabular data
item.description: We allocated those 90, 000 codes to human reviewers, who used our annotation tool to review the codes.

item.title: Learning to Pan-sharpening with Memories of Spatial Details
item.description: To address this issue, in this paper, we observe that the spatial details from PAN images are mainly high-frequency cues, i. e., the edges reflect the contour of input PAN images.

item.title: MyDigitalFootprint: an extensive context dataset for pervasive computing applications at the edge
item.description: To demonstrate the dataset's effectiveness, we present three context-aware applications utilizing various machine learning tasks: (i) a social link prediction algorithm based on physical proximity data, (ii) daily-life activity recognition using smartphone-embedded sensors data, and (iii) a pervasive context-aware recommender system.

item.title: Assessing Dataset Quality Through Decision Tree Characteristics in Autoencoder-Processed Spaces
item.description: In this paper, we delve into the critical aspect of dataset quality assessment in machine learning classification tasks.

item.title: Automatic Annotation of Direct Speech in Written French Narratives
item.description: The automatic annotation of direct speech (AADS) in written text has been often used in computational narrative understanding.

item.title: Non-parametric online market regime detection and regime clustering for multidimensional and path-dependent data structures
item.description: In this work we present a non-parametric online market regime detection method for multidimensional data structures using a path-wise two-sample test derived from a maximum mean discrepancy-based similarity metric on path space that uses rough path signatures as a feature map.

item.title: Automatic Truss Design with Reinforcement Learning
item.description: Directly applying end-to-end reinforcement learning (RL) methods to truss layout design is infeasible either, since only a tiny portion of the entire layout space is valid under the physical constraints, leading to particularly sparse rewards for RL training.

item.title: Understanding Client Reactions in Online Mental Health Counseling
item.description: Communication success relies heavily on reading participants' reactions.

item.title: Face Morphing Attack Detection with Denoising Diffusion Probabilistic Models
item.description: Existing MAD techniques predominantly rely on discriminative models that learn from examples of bona fide and morphed images and, as a result, often exhibit sub-optimal generalization performance when confronted with unknown types of morphing attacks.

item.title: Exploiting Pseudo Future Contexts for Emotion Recognition in Conversations
item.description: Specifically, for an utterance, we generate its future context with pre-trained language models, potentially containing extra beneficial knowledge in a conversational form homogeneous with the historical ones.

item.title: Constructing Multilingual Code Search Dataset Using Neural Machine Translation
item.description: Code search is a task to find programming codes that semantically match the given natural language queries.

item.title: PyBADS: Fast and robust black-box optimization in Python
item.description: PyBADS is a Python implementation of the Bayesian Adaptive Direct Search (BADS) algorithm for fast and robust black-box optimization (Acerbi and Ma 2017).

item.title: ShuttleSet22: Benchmarking Stroke Forecasting with Stroke-Level Badminton Dataset
item.description: We also hold a challenge, Track 2: Forecasting Future Turn-Based Strokes in Badminton Rallies, at CoachAI Badminton Challenge 2023 to boost researchers to tackle this problem.

item.title: YouTube-ASL: A Large-Scale, Open-Domain American Sign Language-English Parallel Corpus
item.description: Machine learning for sign languages is bottlenecked by data.

item.title: KnowPrefix-Tuning: A Two-Stage Prefix-Tuning Framework for Knowledge-Grounded Dialogue Generation
item.description: We propose Knowledgeable Prefix Tuning (KnowPrefix-Tuning), a two-stage tuning framework, bypassing the retrieval process in a knowledge-grounded conversation system by injecting prior knowledge into the lightweight knowledge prefix.

item.title: Simulating counterfactuals
item.description: Counterfactual inference considers a hypothetical intervention in a parallel world that shares some evidence with the factual world.

item.title: Easing Color Shifts in Score-Based Diffusion Models
item.description: This network architecture substantially improves the resulting spatial means of the generated images, and we show that the improvement is approximately independent of the size of the generated images.

item.title: Machine learning in solar physics
item.description: The application of machine learning in solar physics has the potential to greatly enhance our understanding of the complex processes that take place in the atmosphere of the Sun.

item.title: A Meta-analytical Comparison of Naive Bayes and Random Forest for Software Defect Prediction
item.description: We conducted a systematic literature review by establishing criteria to search and choose papers, resulting in five studies.

item.title: What Makes ImageNet Look Unlike LAION
item.description: ImageNet was famously created from Flickr image search results.

item.title: Anomaly Detection in Networks via Score-Based Generative Models
item.description: Node outlier detection in attributed graphs is a challenging problem for which there is no method that would work well across different datasets.

item.title: [Re] Double Sampling Randomized Smoothing
item.description: This paper is a contribution to the reproducibility challenge in the field of machine learning, specifically addressing the issue of certifying the robustness of neural networks (NNs) against adversarial perturbations.

item.title: Exploiting Inferential Structure in Neural Processes
item.description: Neural Processes (NPs) are appealing due to their ability to perform fast adaptation based on a context set.

item.title: Adaptive Annealed Importance Sampling with Constant Rate Progress
item.description: This algorithm relies on a sequence of interpolating distributions bridging the target to an initial tractable distribution such as the well-known geometric mean path of unnormalized distributions which is assumed to be suboptimal in general.

item.title: Transferability Metrics for Object Detection
item.description: In our experiments, we compare TLogME to state-of-the-art metrics in the estimation of transfer performance of the Faster-RCNN object detector.

item.title: CellViT: Vision Transformers for Precise Cell Segmentation and Classification
item.description: Nuclei detection and segmentation in hematoxylin and eosin-stained (H&E) tissue images are important clinical tasks and crucial for a wide range of applications.

item.title: DCID: Deep Canonical Information Decomposition
item.description: Canonical Correlation Analysis (CCA)-based methods have traditionally been used to identify shared variables, however, they were designed for multivariate targets and only offer trivial solutions for univariate cases.

item.title: Semi-supervised Multimodal Representation Learning through a Global Workspace
item.description: Recent deep learning models can efficiently combine inputs from different modalities (e. g., images and text) and learn to align their latent representations, or to translate signals from one domain to another (as in image captioning, or text-to-image generation).
